comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: Rockhampton and the Fitzroy River has a strong history of rowing. The Fitzroy Boating Club was formed in August, 1863 and a press regatta was rowed in May, 1805. The Fitzroy Rowing Club was formed on September 5, 1877, with a membership of 102. The inaugural regatta was held on May 24, 1878, with the principal event, the senior fours, being won by F. K. Ogg, S. W. Hartley, H. Salmon, and W. Sewell (stroke). Numerous regattas and races followed and the sport boomed. The Central Queensland Rowing Club was founded in 1882, and the Lakes Creek Rowing Club in 1894. In 1880, the Fitzroy Club was renamed the Rockhampton Rowing Club and regattas were held regularly twice a year.

comment.author: 52257493@N00
comment._content: Looking at Google Earth, the building with the dome may be the Customs House, still standing today as a restaurant. www.customshouserockhampton.com.au/about-us/ What do you think?

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mobili] We agree. I think the location of the Customs House right on the river gives weight to that. Will now check that we have the geolocation of this image just so. thanks from SLQ

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: Have amended the location of this picture to be on the riverside near Customs House. Always a dilemma for us as to where to geolocate photos - the place of what's in the photo, or the place from which the photo was taken. Looking at the map, it seems clear to us that the photo must have been taken from the Fitzroy Bridge.

comment._content: I wonder if this was perhaps earlier than 1930. Some ladies look to be in long white dresses more indicative of around 1910.
